This botanical garden should not be missed on a tour of Sri Lanka. Such a amazing place and has wide varieties of plants. Well maintained. Air was fresh, nice and cool in the morning and very relaxing. A must do while you are in Kandy.

We decided to Visit the botanical gardens during our whistle stop tour of Kandy. We were not disappointed!! By far the best thing we did in Kandy. The gardens are a complete contrast to the busy city centre. Huge open spaces, very quiet and peaceful.... just don’t look up!!!!! About halfway through walking round/through the gardens, we looked up only to see 1000’s of bats the size of cats in the trees. Despite being harmless, it can be a little intimidating. Strongly recommend to anyone visiting Kandy. This has to be on your list of things to do.
You must see this place when you go to kandy , amazing, wonderful place and it was one of the places i really like, big trees with alot of roots, all kinds of tree.

Well worth going and spending half day here. There are less flowers in the gardens than I expected and the gardens are dominated by large trees, with some particularly impressive specimens. There are also large collections of Bamboo and palms. There is also a reasonably nice orchid house. I think I was most impressed by the large number of flying foxes (bats) that roost in the trees in the corner near the suspension bridge. There are thousands, and the information board says 24k which I can believe. They make quite a racket, and you do see quite a number flying around which is impressive as they are huge. One minor critism is that there were too few benches, and those that were available were always occupied by courting couples, it seems to be where they come. Overall a great place to spend a few hours, although not in the same league as other  botantical gardens such as the one in Singapore which is a lot bigger with a vastly superior collection of orchids.
Overall a wonderful experience.  Calm and serene, this garden shows some amazing plants, trees, and flowers.  The orchid garden was particularly beautiful.
It was great to spend a few hours wandering around the gardens. There were a number of school groups at the gardens when i visited and one group took great delight in meeting me and having selfies.

They may not be the greatest gardens you'll ever see but as we had a morning to fill in, a nice long walk through the gardens was perfect before continuing on our road trip through Sri Lanka. For once we didn't have our heads buried in a guide book, we just roamed and discovered as we went, including a very nice cafe that made VG coffee. The gardens are big and nicely laid out, another legacy of the British Colonial era. The air was fresh, nice and cool in the morning and very relaxing.

We only had an hour to enjoy this immaculate haven but we could have stayed for much longer. Every part of the garden was excellently kept. The highlights we found included the massive bamboo trees, the Orchid House and the Flower Garden. We were here around midday and found it to be very hot. I would recommend visiting at a cooler part of the day to really be able to take everything in.

Well worth spending a couple of hours here as they are truly lovely. The orchid house is especially nice but the collections of bamboo, the herb garden but mainly the general fantastic layout of the garden. A must do while you are in Kandy

I had been really looking forward to visiting here and it did not disappoint! Beautiful trees, flowers, gardens, orchids and lots of opportunity to spot wildlife and birds. We arrived morning and walked anti- clockwise and found it very quiet as most people seemed to be going clockwise, I especially loved the walk down cabbage patch lane. Highly recommend a visit but take plenty of water, it is very hot!

I have visited the "Royal Botanical Garden" twice and like to see again and again. There are so many local plants, trees and foreign plants also. Very attractive place is the Orchid Garden, you can see so many Orchid flowers in it. I would like to thanks the staff of toilets cleaning, because they doing their job very well and so many cafes also are there. Recommended for full day or half day-outing trip here.

These botanical gardens are so pretty. You just cant stop admiring nature. But the weather these days is so so hot. It ruins your trip. Better to take a buggy ride all around the park, else you might not be able to cover it all. Start late in noon so its some nice stroll. The bamboo plantation is just mesmerizing. Some very old trees, some trees planted by royal guests, spices trees area and a suspended bridge are some highlights where you should stop. P.s i was so amazed to find really clean restrooms!
Amazing trees and rare species. Good collection of orchids. Too bad we did not had a guide to explain the plants in the medicinal garden. Restaurant is very good. I recommand it.

we visited the garden today and found a truly amazing collection of plants and trees. If you want to spend a half day or more that is no problem. Al the trees and plants are well marked. And there are flying foxes in the trees near the river. it's all well maintained and beautifully made. A must do when you visit kandy

It really is tourist friendly as advertised with delicious food and drinks at very reasonable prices overlooking the gardens and when I was silly enough to walk away without my bag they locked it up and returned it with a smile when I returned 20 minutes later!

You can cheat and spend 250rupees on taking an electric car around the main areas, but it pays to walk because you see so much more, including the large colony of flying foxes hanging from the trees. The garden is full of delights and everything is well signed in English.

My tour guide took me here @l was not disappointed very large area so we took shuttle tour  the quide explained all the trees plants very informative l loved the orchid house ask grow orchids back in Australia highly recommend you won't want to miss this one while in kandy

Lovely gardens to stroll around or even take a picnic. Some really beautiful rare trees all nicely labelled with good descriptions of what they are used for. A lot are medicinal and still used in medicine today. The orchid house is really beautiful unfortunately when we were there it was very busy so try and time it so you can have a really good look around at these beautiful plants.

For us this was the highlight of our visit to Kandy.  The gardens are excellent.  Beautifully laid out, well documented and surprisingly peaceful. They compare very favourably with Kew and those in Madeira.  You do not need to be heavily into gardening or a botanist to enjoy these gardens - just relax and walk. One word of caution.  It can be very hot, though there is a lot of shade.  Take plenty of water, or, if the heat is problem, use the buggy for a guided tour.

Great day out with my clients. It was very peaceful and relaxing to walk around. You can hire a buggy there itself if you want to see it all within limited time. Tickets can be purchased at the office. Wonderful gardens immaculately maintained with a superb orchid house, plant house and green houses. The information was very clear and everywhere. Countless fruit bats. The baby monkeys are adorable! Set up in 1821. If you like huge mature beautiful gardens and parks .....you will love this place...It’s like an oasis of fresh clean air and wide open spaces in a busy city. Highly recommend you to visit and to have lovely couple of hours if you will go to Kandy.

This is a beautiful location to visit on a warm, sunny day. It is a moderately large park so one has the option of having a great walk but there is also a shuttle bus that moves from one important part of the park to another (at an added cost above and beyond the price of entry). There are many amazing sections including imported species of trees and flowers from other parts of SE Asia and even South America. The orchid building is wonderful to visit, albeit it a little hot and humid. There are a large number of bats in the trees as well as birds. A very peaceful place to visit after the intensity of the surrounding city.

We visited late in the day and foot sore from earlier excursions so took a buggy with a knowledgeable driver,which was not very expensive.  A vast range of plants and trees in well organised sections, well worth a visit to experience another side of the busy city.

Very boring place in Kandy. It’s a normal garden for most of the people, however it is heaven for plant lovers as they can find variety of trees and flowers over here. Nothing to do here and you will find lots of local couples romancing behind the trees. Also you will find lots of local school students coming for a day picnic here. Fees is too high for visitors which 3000 Rs for a couple. Entry to a garden with nothing to do is very high. Moreover there are buggies operating in the garden but again at a very high cost and their availability is very low. You will have to wait a lot for your turn. Not a worthy place to visit! Avoid if you can!

Really beautiful park, with loads of of trees (some really uncommon), flowers and animals. Was able to spot a few animals, such as bats (in huge number), squirrels, snakes and birds. Probably the best attraction in Kandy area.

We thought we may spend a couple of hours here and ended up leaving 4 hours later. It has a vast array of species from all around the world growing. There are plenty of toilets, cafes and restaurants scattered around to keep you hydrated. There is a shuttle bus available at a small cost if you get tired of walking. There are signposts well placed to find your way around but I found it a little difficult to follow the supplied map which came following the 1500 LKR entrance fee for foreigners.

We had a lovely morning tour of botanical gardens and Orchard house. We had a cart that made visiting easy. We stopped as necessary. We even saw monkeys. The orchards were beautiful. I also like the gift store and the vendors waiting outside!
There are lots of tropic trees and flowers from all over the world. Very nice place to be away from the city noise. Spend 3.4 hours there.

This type of visit is generally not to my liking, so I was pleasantly surprised to have enjoyed it quite so much. It was included on our Tour itinerary, but I believe entry was about £7 equivalent & well worth it. A tranquil place, despite the large number of visitors. We saw the fruit bats in flight, visited the Orchid house, saw the tree plaques with plantings by many famous personages etc. Our guide was very knowledgeable & this enhanced the trip. Depending on your level of interest, one could spend most of a day here.

We spend a couple of hours here at the end of our day that started in Dambulla and ended in Kandy, and they were a thoroughly enjoyable couple of hours. If we hadn't told our driver to come back in two hours we might have stayed a little longer, but I think we saw most of the highlights. The orchids are of course fabulous, but to me the most impressive were the tress with plaques showing who had planted them and one. I must say the future Czar Nicholas II did a great job, as did Edward VII while Prince of Wales. You wouldn't miss a great deal by skipping the suspension bridge My one regret was that we were too early to see the flying foxes, and I failed to find the trees they were roosting in. You wouldn't think 24,000 of them could hide so well Lots of rather sweet young local couple walking round holding hands

These are very well organised and set up gardens. Some very interesting specimens, and thousands of flying foxes fruit bats (24 thousand apparently). There are regular small bus tours around the grounds which would be worth taking, or simply stroll around yourself.

Loved this wonderful place. Best thing of all was the golf cart we rented to get around as it was punishingly hot. The guide was knowledgeable and pointed out trees planted by notable people. The orchid house was the highlight but we also liked the three palm lined avenues and the lake. It was so quiet and calm here.
It's nice to see this beautiful and old Garden. Full of tree, and nice park. It's a place for walk and relaxing, maybe one of the best place in Kandy...

The entrance fee for tourists is 1500 rupee each, and they give you a map of the walks and locations of plants. There are free toilets, water points, and shops inside selling food and drinks so don’t panic if you aren’t prepared. The whole place is amazing and has such wide varieties of plants. You can get lovely photos like on Instagram at the palm tree walks and the large open green is great to sit in the shade part way through your walks and get your energy back for the rest. We leisurely walked around and stayed inside circa 2-3 hours, but if you were very interested I’m sure 4 hours would be plenty. There are TUK TUK drivers outside, as ours didn’t want to wait, but please note they will ask a premium to get back to Kandy but we just asked a few and one was wiki f to take us back for 300 rupee rather than 700.
Excellent visit with a private guide extremely knowledgeable and interesting. It is a must when in Kandy. When in the garden must visit the orchard house, well presented with many species.

The gardens are very well looked after and are beautiful. The fruit bats in the trees were great to watch. the range of species was vast and the whole gardens very well planned. There is a super grass area which local school children were using. There is a good cafe/restaurant and plenty of clean toilets. A really good day out.
Get out of the noise and madness of the city and spend a wonderful couple of hours wandering these lovely gardens. Stunning flowers, awesome giant bamboo and the orchids are breathtaking.

If you are in or close to Kandy and have a few hours to spare I'm certain you won't regret a visit to the Royal Botanical Gardens, which having visited once I'd return again and again, if I ever had the chance. At the time of writing this there are nearly 4,500 reviews on TA so I'm certain I can't add anything new. There's so much to see and enjoy, and as well as plants we also managed to tick off a couple of new bird species which we'd never seen before, although surprisingly we didn't see any fruit bats ( perhaps we were just in the wrong place or at the wrong time). The only congestion we experienced was in the orchid house, elsewhere there's 60 hectares to roam, so space for everyone. Highly recommended.

We visited this beautiful botanical garden on our way to Nuwara eliya from Kandy on a morning. It was very calming experience and got the chance to identify lot of new plants most of them native to Sri Lanka. it was a well maintained park where you can go and spend the time relaxingly. lot of space for children to run around and have fun. However, try to visit in a morning and on a less crowdy day.

This Royal Botanical garden is really beautiful. We were there for about two hours which was insufficient. Allow as much time as you can as the grounds are vast. If you are short on time, it might be better to take a guide. The gardens are set in a loop in the Mahawli Ganga (river)  on about 150 acres of land but it feels more spacious. Highlights for me: Lovely Orchid house, Royal Palm Avenue, Suspension Bridge, Sri Lankan shaped pond, The Great lawn, the rows of trees planted by visiting dignatories over the years, the fruit bats & the macaque monkeys.

We visited the Royal Botanical Gardens with friends and thoroughly enjoyed another walk through the beautiful gardens. There is always something new to see every time we go there, including the area of trees planted by famous visitors - King Edward VII and Czar Nicholas II for example.

I love the peace and tranquility of the Royal Botanical Gardens. The plants, Mameluke and birds help to create a haven of calm amidst the frantic hustle and bustle that is Sri Lankan traffic. For me a must visit. I read people complaining that foreigners pay more than locals. What a good idea, pity we don’t do that in the U.K.

We visited here yesterday. It was 1500 rupees each and well worth the money. We went in over a suspension bridge which was quite bouncy but there is another entrance if you are not keen on that idea. We felt we didn’t have enough time here as we were meeting our driver and could have happily stayed another couple of hours. There is a cafe and an ice cream place in the centre.
Approx 20 mins outside Kandy (very busy roads) this is a real treat for those who love gardens, trees, flowers and history.

Great for nature lovers, should ideally go in the early morning or close to sunset to avoid the heat of the afternoon. Many species of birds, a very large roost of Flying Foxes, lovely gardens intersting collection of fauna - but the relatively poor labelling of the plants robs some of the pleasure of the garden.

Park is lovely and peacefull. Do not bother to order sri lankan omelette in cafeteria. U get only bland omelette with few bits of tomato. Asked about it from waitress. They just throwed me a loads of chili on different plate next to omelette. Been in Sri Lanka 1 month and this is definetly the Worst customer experience this far.

This is probably the most wonderful botanical garden I have visited. There is a staggering array of trees, bamboos, ferns and colourful flowers from all over the world. Even the huge grassed areas are remarkably attractive. The hundreds of fruit bats in some of the trees are spectacular to see. The orchid house is small but nevertheless very good, although it would help if there were labels identifying the various types. We spent about 2.5 hours here but would have happily spent much longer if time had allowed.
When you think ur mind should be calm then visit here will be it’s sure because when you walk you feel the creation of god and the peace of mind
There are a range of trees, plants, herbs & flowers. Huge garden for a nice leisurely stroll. Cost 1500 Rupees per person

Wonderful gardens immaculately maintained with a superb orchid house and plant house. Set up in 1821, it has been extended and added to ever since. There are some magnificent trees, both indigenous as well as tropical all set out in extensive grounds. By the river is the extraordinary sight of the flying fox bats with wingspans of over 1mtr. For those at all interested in flora , this is a must see, and a very enjoyable way to spend a couple of hours.

We could have spent the whole day here. Such beautiful mature trees, palms, shrubs and flowers and so well kept. There are lots of shad d places to sit down in when you are a bit frazzled with the sun. It is worth going. My favourite was the memorial garden area with trees planted by past and present world leaders and famous figures from history. The flying foxes are also a must-see.

Great day out with my mum, was very peaceful and relaxing to walk around, the greenhouses were beautiful, however not many flowers were outside due to the time of year, so would defiantly come back in summer time to see the flowers. We booked last minute and got discount online so would defiantly recommend booking online! However the orangery restaurant was awful!!!! Would not recommend, floors were disgusting, food was over priced, waitresses looked unhappy, coffee from machine was disgusting and the doors were constantly being left open making it cold inside! So that’s the only bad thing I would say. Overall the gardens were beautiful.
Nice beautiful cool place in hot Sri Lankan hot weather. Natural cools air will full of oxyzen lot of flowers and trees

Not normally my cup of tea but everyone spoke to recommended it after a long drive and visit to the tooth temple and tbh I wasn’t disappointed! Very well kept vast gardens with many points of interest and some beautiful floral arrangements !

We took side entrance using suspension bridge, which was fantastic. At the end of it number of monkeys “welcomed” us. You should be careful though as they are far for being innocent. The botanical garden is a must see in Kandy. It’s calm and relaxing and you can walk around as there is plenty shadow provided by some amazing trees. Entrance fee for 2 adults and 2 children is 4500 Rs.

it was not worth the money, I experienced nicer gardens even without the need to pay. We were visiting on Friday and there were lots of school groups visiting. We expected to have a relaxing walk and sit for a coffee in nice surroundings, but it was not possible. Go only if you have some time to spare and want to stay away from the Kandy city center.
An incredible collection of plant life, small and large, and well worth a visit. Take a hat and plenty of water because it get's very hot walking the grounds, but well worth the effort.

Really lovely gardens and huge so you can avoid the crowds that inevitable gather here. Lots of plants and trees to see and learn about but most people engage with the monkeys. There is an amazing colony of fruit bats in the trees by the river. Allow 2-3 hours to stroll around slowly in the heat.

Visited as part of a group and the buggy was recommended by our local guide. A great idea as the driver spoke excellent English, was very knowledgeable and clearly loves these gardens. Highlights were the royal planted trees, the palm tree walk, orchid house and the cafe with a cool breeze wafting over the terrace while we had a late lunch and cold beers. Even if you have little interest in botanical gardens do visit. It’s like an oasis of fresh clean air and wide open spaces in a busy city.

Director-General Dr. Krishnarajah is fantastic. Emptying if garbage cans should be done more frequently. Milk bar at the entrance are staffed by rude locals who are abusive to children. Guy with pony tail was on drugs, or acted like one. They entire staff should be replaced immediately.

We were on a day tour from the Cinnamon Grand to the Elephant Orphanage and Temple of the Tooth and our guide, Nishantha, suggested visiting the gardens. They were stunning. Unlike NZ and the UK there is no need for glasshouses and we saw many beautiful and imposing plants. The age of the trees is impressive as it is an old park (1371AD). The Great Circle was really interesting as dignitaries over the last 150 years have been planting trees. There was a riot of colour in places, awesome avenues and gigantic bamboos. The gardens are huge (147 acres) and  we would recommend paying 250 rupees (2 NZ$) extra and taking the shuttle tour if you only have limited time. You could easily spend a day here and it was a romantic spot for couples.

We could easily have spent all day here. Peaceful, quiet but beautiful. The variety of plants is amazing. Originally a royal pleasure garden  but laid out by the British in 1824. Look pout for the flying foxes!!

The botanical gardens are well worth a visit. Very well maintained grounds. You can take a buggy around however there is no English commentary. A few more English signs on the trees and plants would go over well.

Beautiful gardens just outside of the town, quite large well laid out and easy to navigate , lots of unusual plants and trees with a large poulation of fruit bats at the top end of the gardens. Well worth a trip and easy to spend 3 or 4 hours here. Nice orchid house and a variety of animal and bird life.

Love this place and keep coming back. Tranquil and calming. Like other reviews I love the fruit bats and just walking through the trees. One big gripe is lack of books or other publications. Asked guy in shop if they had books about trees or the gardens. He seemed to think this was an astounding thing to ask. Would have liked to be able to find out more about what I was looking at.

This is a very nice and beautiful garden. It is a pretty large park so the best way to see it is by cart. This takes about an hour and cost is very little. Well worth the visit and a great way to fill in the day.

A great way to escape the manic nature of kandy for a couple of hours. This is an oasis of calm. The gardens are beautifully kept and the fox bats are an experience to see. Lots of deliffirent plants, trees and flowers from around the world are kept here. Just a few things our guide helped with. Always enter and leave via the suspension bridge entrance as it is much quieter, watch out for the monkeys, they will steal anything if you give them an opportunity and take plenty of water. There are places to buy stuff but not a great deal of variety? Worth a visit.

I’m not usually a botanical gardens kind of guy, but we really enjoyed this place and it was a lovely escape from the chaos of Kandy. We spent a couple of peaceful hours wandering around these large beautiful gardens. Admittedly there were a lot of people here but it never seemed busy once we’d left the entrance behind. Lots of different garden houses to visit plus a couple of impressive avenues of palm trees, a picturesque lake and plenty of places to sit and watch the world go by. We also saw a whole lot of bats in some strange leaning trees, I’ve no idea why they were leaning so dramatically. If you need refreshments there’s couple of cafes for a drink. Lovely, peaceful and definitely a good place to wander around if you have some spare time on your hands. Iain, London
Wonderful. I really enjoyed seeing the fantastic range of plants. The large colony of bats that are in the trees along the river are fascinating.

We spent two hours here and could have easily spent longer. Amazing variety of trees, beautifully upkept lawns. This place is used by locals and tourists alike. Entrance fee was 1500 rupees. The park is also home to colonies of fruit bats which are fascinating to watch. If you have the time this provides calm away from the hustle and bustle of Kandy
Spent 3 hours wandering around being amazed at the variety of plants on display. Stunning orchids, enormous bamboo, medicinal plants and loads more
Loved this place ! so absolutely beautiful.....If you like huge mature beautiful gardens and parks .....you will love this place.... Lots of shade but where a hat !

The gardens are huge and crammed with specimens although it has to be said that the bulk are trees and shrubs and these are the main strength of the place. We found the display houses disappointing and lacking in inspiration but there are some really splendid palm-lined avenue walkways and spectacular clusters of bamboo. It’s really like a huge park for which there is a £7 entry fee. There is a local bus runs from Kandy clock tower for 40 rupees and the journey takes about 25 minutes.

These gardens are definitely worth a visit. We spent 6 hours there, and could have spent longer. Great value for money, but regardless of that, there was so much to see, in these immaculately well kept gardens, which were easy to wander around, and a total joy to absorb oneself in. There was a vast array of plants and trees, ferns and spices, and a suspension bridge well worth walking over!. The gardens are set alongside the river, which made for a stunning setting. We travelled by tuk tuk each way which made the entire experience superb and unforgettable.

We went to the Botanical Gardens as part of a two day trip organised by Sam Sampath, Big Brother Tours. Sam had organised a cart and a guide to take us round and I was glad that he did. There is so much to see and a huge area to cover, we learned so much from our guide that we would otherwise never know. The flora is beautiful and the gardens very well maintained. Thoroughly enjoyed our visit and would recommend.

A very good place to visit as part of the visit to Kandy. We used the electric cart for  Lkr 2000 which was worthwhile as the driver was very knowledgeable about the flora and the history. Downside is the poor toilet facilities ( donot even go near them) lack of proper parking facilities.

We thoroughly enjoyed our day walking around these stunning gardens which are beautifully kept. Allow a good 3-4 hours to see everything. There are plenty of seating areas dotted around if you need a rest as well as some picnic areas and a restaurant.  We got caught in a tropical storm and used the time to have a lovely buffet lunch in the restaurant for a reasonable 950 rupees per person.  It was a very enjoyable day out.

An old British era botanical garden- huge and well maintained.  You will beautiful well manicured lawns and some exclusive orchid varieties. Some very exotic and rare trees are found here. Ticket is LKR 1000 for adults and 500 for children. Be prepared for some walking.  There are electric buggies but not sufficient for the crowd.

large , well designed garden with beautiful collection trees and flowers. Especially the tree collection is impressing.I  couldn’t see everything as my driver was waiting. Most of all it is very very well kept. next best to me with the « jardins de pamplemousse » on Mauritius. tip : go urly in  the morning as it  gets stickier around noon

We had such a perfect day exploring the gardens, I’d recommend it to anyone who has some spare time when visiting Kandy, so many interesting things to see, including this strange Irish man pretending to be a tree.

Could have spent a whole day in the Garden as it is just gorgeous. The Garden takes up 147 acres with over 4,000 species. Lots of walking around but I did see a trolley bus. The garden has different areas including the Orchid House, Great Lawn, Lake, Spice Garden (reached via a suspension bridge), Flower Garden and Palm Avenue to name a few all with magnificent plant specimens. It will take a few hours but when you're tired you can sit down on beautiful manicured lawn and rest a while. There's a busy cafe near the Great Lawn but toilets are few and far between.

The botanical gardens are the largest in Sri Lanka, with huge areas of green well kept lawns. There are many different aspects to the gardens which contain specific sections such as orchids, rubber trees, the palm avenue to name a few. Giant fruit bats hang in the trees and fly screeching overhead. There's more than enough to keep you here for a few hours.

We spent a very pleasant 3 hours here and covered most of the gardens. The highlight was the fruit bats which were amazing, spread over the left side of the park and in their thousands. The orchids were beautiful and the trees in the arboretum spectacular, huge buttress roots lianas.  We had cold drinks at a kiosk  and coffee in the cafe, buffet lunch was available. All was good with the exception of 2 gardeners who begged for money. We went on to the 3 temples loop, a nice change to go to sites with only a few other tourists and worth the time.

There are plenty of nature’s delights here. Firstly, the trees are magnificent and there are so many different species, many are endemic. Secondly, you can see a number of colourful birds here. Thirdly, how about the huge red fruit bats that fill the trees in their hundreds! Not to mention the macaques which roam the gardens looking for scraps. There is also a very good cafe which has good value buffet food. If you need to get back to Kandy when your visit is over, and you are fed up haggling with tuktuk drivers, just jump on the bus and pay a few rupees (around 9 pence). Brilliant place.
There are so many varieties of beautiful plants, flowers and spices. Having the monkeys around makes the experience even better. Highly Recommended.

a garden with a huge variety of plants, some not even available in other parts of the world.  a very enjoyable walk and the gardens even had an orchid flower house with different varieties of orchids.

We were taken to the gardens by our guide ‘Obama’. It was a beautiful and relaxing place to visit, except the bangers being set of to scare the fruit bats off! We really enjoyed our time there. The orchid house, the avenue of palms and all the different examples of plants and trees were well worth the visit. We both would definitely like to visit the gardens again.
A spacious and picturesque escape from the hustle and bustle of Kandy. Take the time out for a pleasant stroll (45-60 mins) around the perimeter, or just sit and enjoy refreshments at the restaurant.

It was our first attraction visited in Sri Lanka and one that we found with the best value. Great and majestic with a high diversity of exotic trees and plants. Truly worth the visit. I would recommend going in the morning when it's not too hot.

These gardens are well laid out, with various sections including orchid houses, perennials, and avenues of various trees.  They are clearly labelled so if you like collecting information it is easy to take photos of the notices. A one end of the garden the fruit bats keep up a continuous shrieking. It is quite awesome to see so many of these creatures hanging from the trees. Some of the trees are quite old and have fantastic root structures.  This is a lovely way to spend a couple of hours.
Huge grounds with the most amazing gardebs to easily walk around and enjoy. Lovely orchid house. Watch out for the trees full of bat's at one end. Everyone will enjoy this

It is almost larger than you can take in in one day. I'm glad we went. It was cool to see nutmeg trees for the first time. It was really interesting to stroll under hundreds of roosting bats at the far end of the park. There special environment houses for cacti and orchids. There are many open park areas in which to simply relax and enjoy the surroundings.There are a few pleasant views of the river - and then there is that rickety suspension bridge people stand in line to walk on! But there are few concessions inside the gates and when it got hot, we decided we had enough.

I could've spent at least a day here.  So much to see and take in.  I would've liked the golf buggies to be free to those who need them - or for people at one far end of the garden, trying to get to the other end in 30 degree heat and high humidity!  Nonetheless one of the highlights of my wanders in a city.

Visited here on Jan 21st,2019. This garden is more floral than the Hakgala botanical gardens. Plenty of couples and white skinned foreign tourists here. You can also pay extra to sit in a buggy and see the place with live commentary and photo stops by the driver - which we did here. Since it is quite large if you plan on covering it by foot/walk then plan to easily spend at least 4 hours here.
Had a great few hours here enjoying the green spaces and variety of trees and plants, could have spent a great deal more time exploring. well worth the visit

Botanical garden is located approx. 5.5 km before the Kandy city center bordering Mahaweli river. A historical park dated back to 1371 has over 4000 species of plants including some endemic ones to Sri Lanka. Loved exploring rose and orchid gardens but, felt orchid varieties were not enough. But whatever available wad not disappointing. Enjoyed Walking along the two palm avenues and cabbage avenue. There are more avenues, but couldn't try them all. Entire park is approx. 147 acre which may take 1/2 day to cover.
Great place to escape the madness of the temple of the tooth. Good place for people watch and the café is a nice location if a bit pricey. Would love to spend more time here

Its a beautiful and well-organised garden, with some impressive trees. We were there around 2pm and walked for 2.5 hrs. Alot of shade and a good constant breeze kept us cool. We saw lots of squirrels, monkeys, lizards and a few interesting birds. The kids were pretty excited about spotting these. We also took lots of photos and making silly poses. All the trees and shrubs were impressive, and very interesting. The gardens were well kept and quite beautiful, looking like a scene from an European garden. Great walk after lunch and great family bonding too!

One of the nicest green spaces i've ever experienced Just a quick glance at all the trip advisor reviews on here and its obvious the botanical gardens are popular and highly rated. I can only add weight to that and say that we thoroughly enjoyed spending an afternoon here, though you could spend a full day if you had the time. We were contemplating just having a rest day round the pool at the hotel but decided to make the journey here and we were SO glad we did. Other places should look to this place as an example of a well thought out, maintained and looked after urban green space. It contains a bewildering variety of plants and trees, giant fruit bats hanging from and flying between the trees, monkeys you can get right up close to, lakes, and an orchid house with some of the most amazing flowers. There is a cafe / buffet restaurant in the park, but this would make a lovely place to bring a picnic. If you appreciate and enjoy nature and green spaces then this is a must visit if staying in or near Kandy. It is approx. 15 mins from Kandy city to here by tuk tuk and the fare should cost about 5 GBP. If you have already been on a tuk tuk with a mad driver then you will understand what an 'experience' this is, and if you haven't then do try to experience this at least once in your travels !

A great place to visit just outside Kandy.  15000 rp entrance but beautiful grounds, incredible trees and plants. Good bird life and flying foxes galore.  And the cafe just outside the entrance is cheap and good.

A great place to visit, interesting trees, flying foxes, according to the guide 24,000 of them, a lake, an orchid house and just a really peaceful place to stroll. We could have spent longer here but really enjoyed the visit. If you in Kandy it is a must. Entrance is 1500 rupees.

This place is amazing! I love plants and animals and visiting the beautiful gardens was perfect for me and my husband! You can see a lot of flowers, many types of trees from different parts of the world, friendly monkeys, big bats in the trees and many more. We also loved the orchid house. At the end of our visit, we stopped to the souvenir shop and bought incense sticks and some other local goods for our family and friends.

Very large garden located about 6km away from the city centre (~6 km; 20 mins by tuk tuk). Ticket prices: 1,500 Rs (adult), 1,000 Rs (student. They accept international student IDs). Takes about 2 hrs to go through the garden. Clean, beautiful and great variety of different gardens and plant species. Would highly recommend for those seeking some serenity away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Enjoyed a full day in these splendid gardens and still didn’t see everything.   Highlights included the incredible mahoganies with their extraordinary roots, the cannonball trees whose flowers are so delicate, the talipot palm with an unusual life cycle and the gracious avenue of palms.   Good buffet lunch at the canteen and a kiosk for later refreshments.

These gardens are offering countless species of local exotic flora. My favorite was royal palms, memorial trees and house of orchids but that is just a tiny part of what you can run into there. Reserve few hours and about about 1500lkr for this large area that is an ideal place for walks and relax.

This is a lovely tranquil place in a very busy Kandy. The gardens are really well maintained. There is an area with fruit bats in loads of trees, an orchid house and a very scary looking suspension bridge. The gardens are really worth a visit.
A beautiful place to spend a couple of hours away from the hustle and bustle of Kandy... giant bamboo... lakes..monkeys and bats. So big it can’t really be crowded... calm and tranquil

This is a very nice botanical garden, with many beautiful flowers in the garden, and a great collection of orchids. There is a pleasant relaxed atmosphere, and we could easily have spent more time there.

This park is gorgeous! It's one of my favourite places in the world because it's extremely beautiful and very well-kept. Plus, if you enjoy being in contact with nature, I'm sure you will love spending some time here!
Visited here while on a tour of Sri Lanka.  What an oasis of calm and tranquility!  Some very impressive tree lined avenues and many fabulous specimen trees.

We visited on a very hot day and there is not a lot of shade. Allow a couple of hours and go on the suspension bridge for photo. The orchid house is amazing there is such a variety of plants and trees. The fruit bats were interesting to see and we also saw lots of monkeys. Definitely needs to be on your itinerary when visiting Kandy.

Impressive collection of Trees from all over the World. A pleasant afternoons' diversion from the mayhem of downtown Kandy. The tree collection is quite spectacular. The Orchid House the Rose Garden etc were a little disappointing. That said I have never seen such a range of tree specimens. The Palm avenue and the Giant Bamboo trees are awesome. Well worth a visit for a couple of hours. More interesting than Kandy itself

200 year old royal botanic garden with a huge variety of flora and fauna to see.  TIPS: thousands of bats live on the island, so if you are lucky (or loom long enough, you will definitely see and hear them. unique experience. I would suggest to plan 1.5 hrs. Garden tours on electric gold vehicles are also on offer for those who cant walk long

A beautiful  tranquil  oasis  of greenery and colour amidst the noise and traffic of downtown  Kandy. What a calming place to visit after a hectic day sightseeing in the urban area. With exotic species  of all kinds plus butterflies and birds that really is too much to do and see in one visit. Highly recommended.

Not somewhere we would normally go but had a spare afternoon and made a visit. Very glad we did, beautiful and extensive gardens full of extraordinary trees and specimens. Need at least a couple of hours to explore - suspension bridge over the river, fruit bats flying about and hanging down/dripping from the trees for the night, fascinating canon ball tree and many more surprises.

If you are in Kandy you must go to the Royal Garden, it's amazing, you can have a picnic in one of the parks, have a nice walk through the day and enjoy the shade with the breeze. Just one advise, in one of the paths, there are a lot of bats so be careful when you walk through that part or avoid it. They don't do anything but just in case you are afraid.

This is quite a large botanical garden and takes at least 2-3 hours to walk around. It can also be quite hot as there are large sections of lawn that are unshaded. It's a nice place for a wander, and the orchid house, although not overly large, is really, really good. There's a cafe in the middle if you want to stop for a rest and cold drink.

Really beautiful gardens. Plenty of space to walk around and relax.Very green and lots of places to stay and enjoy the silence. We have seen many amazing specimens. We enjoyed very much the Cook's Pine Avenue.

One of the best maintained botanical gardens ever visited. If you are interested in the plant life scientifically , or just want to spend some good time in middle of best possible flora, this is the place to be. It's huge, so keep at least 3 hours to be spent here. Secondly, follow the map strictly, else u can easily lose track of places visited. Involves a lot of walking,  so not recommended for very young kids. They also have an option of hiring golf cart, but not sure about the prices.

Really nice vast garden lots of interesting trees from all over the world. The garden is home to 24,000 bats which can be seen hanging from the trees, breathtaking. There are  also monkeys in the garden as well as a suspension bridge over a river which can be walked on. There is a lovely buffet that can be had for lunch as well.

Slightly outside of Kandy with a not cheap entry price,especially for those that are accustomed to free access to parks, but well worth a visit. Wonderful place to while away several hours in a generally peaceful and interesting environment. There are lots of plants that were impressive (and a huge herd of bats) and that we’ve not seen before, and also interesting installations. Bring water - it gets hot and only some parts have shade. Lots of picnickers too. There is a shuttle that goes around as the grounds are really large.
Worth spending at least two plus hours here. So many interesting trees. Lots of wide open space, a wobbly suspension bridge at the back and free range monkeys.
Royal Botnical Gardens in Kandy is the most beautiful place in Sri Lanka. It appears you have entred a dreamland with beautiful flowers all around. A must visit during your Sri Lanka trip

The royal botanical gardens are beautifully maintained and we have a chance to see so many different varieties of trees and plants from different parts of the world. The kids had a great time there and there was a beautiful lake shaped like Srilanka. We got to see different palm varieties and the double coconut tree.
Very well maintained gardens with beautiful flowers and trees.  A very pleasant afternoons walk around this large estate,

I will begin by saying that I've been to more than my share of overpriced attractions in Asia. This garden, if you are a fan of gardens that is, is worth the 1500 LKR entrance fee. The place is absolutely huge, rubbish free, and very well maintained. I wandered around for 3 hours and could have spent longer there. I've certainly seen better collections of specific types of plants, but the overall collection on display here, and the overall feel of the place was special. One minor criticism - I would have loved to see an orchid display 10 times the size of what they currently have (think Singapore's garden). You know they grow here, let's show them off! The day I visited there were dozens of students on a school assignment mingling among the foreign visitors, engaging them in conversation as they practiced speaking English. It was refreshing to see their enthusiasm and I was more than happy to take time to chat with them.
Really surprising Gardens, some of the best maintained and constructed gardens....the collection of fig trees are awe inspiring!

A beautiful large park and gardens in the heart of the city, well worth a wander through. We only got an hour and would suggest a bit longer, we were rather rushed. Some fantastic trees and flowers especially the orchid house, well worth the entry fee.
